paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted two pathogenic BRCA2 variants and detailed penetrance information from a case report.

patients.phenotype: solid pseudopapillary neoplasm of the pancreas and abdominal desmoid tumor

individual_records.phenotype_details: carried BRCA2 mutation but tumors were not BRCA-dependent
individual_records.evidence_sentence: they cannot be considered as BRCA-dependent tumors.

individual_records.phenotype_details: carried BRCA2 mutation but tumors were not BRCA-dependent
individual_records.evidence_sentence: they cannot be considered as BRCA-dependent tumors.

functional_data.summary: Both variants are classified as pathogenic according to the ACMG/AMP criteria.

variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on ACMG/AMP classification
variants.additional_notes: Both variants were confirmed as germline by sequencing of normal tissue.
key_quotes: Both neoplasms harbored a CTNNB1 somatic mutation which was different in each tumor.
The BRCA2 mutations were c.631G>A, resulting in the amino-acid change p.V211I, and c.7008-2A>T, causing a splice acceptor site loss.
